  • Uses of Game in pieces

    Methods in pieces with parameters of type Game
    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    boolean
    Bishop.whenLegal(int[] stc, int[] endc, Game game)
    checks if move is legal based on the coordinates checks diagonality by seeing if the slope between the starting and finishing locations is 1 checks if the piece is attacking, and if the piece it is attacking is on the same team checks if there are pieces in the path from the starting point to the ending point
    boolean
    King.whenLegal(int[] stc, int[] endc, Game game)
    checks if move is legal based on the coordinates implements castling which moves the rook
    boolean
    Knight.whenLegal(int[] stc, int[] endc, Game game)
    checks if move is legal based on the coordinates Makes sure the move is in a "L" shape and not attacking a friendly piece.
    boolean
    Pawn.whenLegal(int[] stc, int[] endc, Game game)
    sees if move is legal by checking the coordinates pawn can move up two spaces upon the first move en passant is put into effect
    abstract boolean
    Piece.whenLegal(int[] stc, int[] endc, Game game)
    Abstract whenLegal() method: checks whether or not a move is legal
    boolean
    Queen.whenLegal(int[] stc, int[] endc, Game game)
    sees if move is legal sees if the move is possible in a diagonal fashion
    boolean
    Rook.whenLegal(int[] stc, int[] endc, Game game)
    sees if the move is legal sees if a horizontal or vertial move is possible and if a friendly piece is attacked looks to see if there is anything in the path from start to finish
